title: Drawing, "Orpheus, Ceres, Design for Vaulted Ceiling, Sala dei Legislatori, Palazzo Conti-Sinibaldi, Faenza", 1787–1802
medium: Pen and ink, brush and greyish-brown wash over black chalk on laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in ink: orfeo inv della musica, cerere inv delle biade.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Orpheus seated beneath trees, plays lyre while quadrupeds and birds listen. Inscribed in ink: orfeo inv della musica.   At right, Ceres show in profile, kneeling and turned toward right, cutting grain with sickle. Temple and trees in rear. Inscribed below: cerere inv delle biade. Lower parts of letters and figures at upper edge.
